intro: Hypochaeris chubutensis, commonly known as the Chubut sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the Patagonian region of Argentina. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and produces yellow flowers with a central disk. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its seeds are dispersed by wind. Hypochaeris chubutensis is an important component of the local flora and is adapted to the harsh environmental conditions of its native range.
